cyclone.name: ROSA
cyclone.current_location: about 495 miles SSW of Punta Eugenia, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north, then turning north-northeast toward the central-northern Baja California Peninsula and the Desert Southwest

weather_observation.watch_coast: Pacific coast of Baja California Peninsula from Punta Abreojos to Cabo San Quintin (Mexico)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Most of Baja California Peninsula, northern Gulf of California, and portions of southern California coast including San Diego
weather_observation.wind: Low (5%) chance of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; more likely breezy 20-30 mph winds Monday night-Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Large long-period swells and dangerous rip currents; no significant surge expected inside San Diego Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches possible Monday night–Tuesday with localized higher totals on coastal slopes
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and high surf could disrupt vessel movements and cargo handling along exposed wharves
